p: Lipid oxidation is a spontaneous and inevitable phenomenon and a major cause of milk deterioration. During this process, double bonds of UFA are attacked by oxidizing compounds, such as free radicals. Although several authors have shown that milk becomes more susceptible to oxidation in response to increased levels of UFA in milk fat [ 13], according to Rafalowski and collaborators, milk oxidative stability seems to be more strongly related to the antioxidant levels in milk than to the fat composition [ 48].
